subsection.title: First Painlevé Equation

para.sentence: Plots of solutions w_{k}(x) of \mbox{P}_{\mbox{\scriptsize I}} with w_{k}(0)=0 and w_{k}^{\prime}(0)=k for various values of k , and the parabola 6w^{2}+x=0.

subsection.sentence: Figure 32.3.1: w_{k}(x) for -12\leq x\leq 1.33 and k=0.5 , 0.75 , 1 , 1.25 , and the parabola 6w^{2}+x=0 , shown in black.
Figure 32.3.2: w_{k}(x) for -12\leq x\leq 2.43 and k=-0.5 , -0.25 , 0 , 1 , 2 , and the parabola 6w^{2}+x=0 , shown in black.
Figure 32.3.3: w_{k}(x) for -12\leq x\leq 0.73 and k=1.85185\;3 , 1.85185\;5 . The two graphs are indistinguishable when x exceeds -5.2 , approximately. The parabola 6w^{2}+x=0 is shown in black.
Figure 32.3.4: w_{k}(x) for -12\leq x\leq 2.3 and k=-0.45142\;7 , -0.45142\;8 . The two graphs are indistinguishable when x exceeds -4.8 , approximately. The parabola 6w^{2}+x=0 is shown in black.

subsection.title: Second Painlevé Equation with \alpha=0

para.sentence: Here w_{k}(x) is the solution of \mbox{P}_{\mbox{\scriptsize II}} with \alpha=0 and such that w_{k}(x)\sim k\mathrm{Ai}\left(x\right), if x\to+\infty; compare §32.11(ii).

subsection.sentence: Figure 32.3.5: w_{k}(x) and k\mathrm{Ai}\left(x\right) for -10\leq x\leq 4 with k=0.5 . The two graphs are indistinguishable when x exceeds -0.4 , approximately.
Figure 32.3.6: w_{k}(x) for -10\leq x\leq 4 with k=0.999 , 1.001 . The two graphs are indistinguishable when x exceeds -2.8 , approximately. The parabola 2w^{2}+x=0 is shown in black.

subsection.title: Fourth Painlevé Equation with \beta=0

para.sentence:
Here u=u_{k}(x;
u) is the solution of  rac{{\mathrm{d}}^{2}u}{{\mathrm{d}x}^{2}}=3u^{5}+2xu^{3}+\left(	frac{1}{4}x ^{2}-
u-	frac{1}{2}ight)u, such that u\sim kU\left(-
u-	frac{1}{2},xight), if x	o+\infty.

The corresponding solution of \mbox{P}_{\mbox{\scriptsize IV}} is given by w(x)=2\sqrt{2}u_{k}^{2}(\sqrt{2}x,
u), with  eta=0 , \alpha=2
u+1 , and w(x)\sim 2\sqrt{2}k^{2}{U^{2}}\left(-
u-	frac{1}{2},\sqrt{2}xight), if x	o+\infty; compare (32.2.11) and §32.11(v).
If we set \ifrac{{\mathrm{d}}^{2}u}{{\mathrm{d}x}^{2}}=0 in (32.3.2) and solve for u , then u^{2}=-\tfrac{1}{3}x\pm\tfrac{1}{6}\sqrt{x^{2}+12\nu+6}.

subsection.sentence: Figure 32.3.7: u_{k}(x;-\tfrac{1}{2}) for -12\leq x\leq 4 with k=0.33554\;691 , 0.33554\;692 . The two graphs are indistinguishable when x exceeds -5.0 , approximately. The parabolas u^{2}+\tfrac{1}{2}x=0 , u^{2}+\tfrac{1}{6}x=0 are shown in black and green, respectively.

Figure 32.3.8: u_{k}(x;\tfrac{1}{2}) for -12\leq x\leq 4 with k=0.47442 , 0.47443 . The two graphs are indistinguishable when x exceeds -2.2 , approximately. The curves u^{2}+\tfrac{1}{3}x\pm\tfrac{1}{6}\sqrt{x^{2}+12}=0 are shown in green and black, respectively.

Figure 32.3.9: u_{k}(x;\tfrac{3}{2}) for -12\leq x\leq 4 with k=0.38736 , 0.38737 . The two graphs are indistinguishable when x exceeds -1.0 , approximately. The curves u^{2}+\tfrac{1}{3}x\pm\tfrac{1}{6}\sqrt{x^{2}+24}=0 are shown in green and black, respectively.

Figure 32.3.10: u_{k}(x;\tfrac{5}{2}) for -12\leq x\leq 4 with k=0.24499\;2 , 0.24499\;3 . The two graphs are indistinguishable when x exceeds -0.6 , approximately. The curves u^{2}+\tfrac{1}{3}x\pm\tfrac{1}{6}\sqrt{x^{2}+36}=0 are shown in green and black, respectively.
